name: sgw_resource_utilization_admin_net_bytes_recv
help: The total number of bytes received (since node start-up) on the network interface to which the Sync Gateway api.admin_interface is bound. By default, that is the number of bytes received on 127.0.0.1:4985 since node start-up.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_admin_net_bytes_sent
help: The total number of bytes sent (since node start-up) on the network interface to which the Sync Gateway api.admin_interface is bound.By default, that is the number of bytes sent on 127.0.0.1:4985 since node start-up.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_error_count
help: The total number of errors logged.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_heapalloc
help: HeapAlloc is bytes of allocated heap objects. "Allocated" heap objects include all reachable objects, as well as unreachable objects that the garbage collector has not yet freed. Specifically, HeapAlloc increases as heap objects are allocated and decreases as the heap is swept and unreachable objects are freed. Sweeping occurs incrementally between GC cycles, so these two processes occur simultaneously, and as a result HeapAlloc tends to change smoothly (in contrast with the sawtooth that istypical of stop-the-world garbage collectors).

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_heapidle
help: HeapIdle is bytes in idle (unused) spans. Idle spans have no objects in them. These spans could be (and may already have been) returned to the OS, or they can be reused for heap allocations, or they can be reused as stack memory. HeapIdle minus HeapReleased estimates the amount of memory that could be returned to the OS, but is being retained by the runtime so it can grow the heap without requesting more memory from the OS. If this difference is significantly larger than the heap size, it indicates there was a recent transient spike in live heap size.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_heapinuse
help: HeapInuse is bytes in in-use spans. In-use spans have at least one object in them. These spans an only be used for other objects of roughly the same size. HeapInuse minus HeapAlloc estimates the amount of memory that has been dedicated to particular size classes, but is not currently being used. This is an upper bound on fragmentation, but in general this memory can be reused efficiently.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_heapreleased
help: HeapReleased is bytes of physical memory returned to the OS. This counts heap memory from idle spans that was returned to the OS and has not yet been reacquired for the heap.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_pausetotalns
help: PauseTotalNs is the cumulative nanoseconds in GC stop-the-world pauses since the program started. During a stop-the-world pause, all goroutines are paused and only the garbage collector can run.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_stackinuse
help: StackInuse is bytes in stack spans. In-use stack spans have at least one stack in them. These spans can only be used for other stacks of the same size. There is no StackIdle because unused stack spans are returned to the heap (and hence counted toward HeapIdle).

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_stacksys
help: StackSys is bytes of stack memory obtained from the OS. StackSys is StackInuse, plus any memory obtained directly from the OS for OS thread stacks (which should be minimal).

name: sgw_resource_utilization_go_memstats_sys
help: Sys is the total bytes of memory obtained from the OS. Sys is the sum of the XSys fields below. Sys measures the virtual address space reserved by the Go runtime for the heap, stacks, and other internal data structures. It's likely that not all of the virtual address space is backed by physical memory at any given moment, though in general it all was at some point.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_goroutines_high_watermark
help: Peak number of go routines since process start.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_num_goroutines
help: The total number of goroutines.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_process_cpu_percent_utilization
help: The CPU's utilization as percentage value. The CPU usage calculation is performed based on user and system CPU time, but it does not include components such as iowait. The derivation means that the values of process_cpu_percent_utilization and %Cpu, returned when running the top command, will differ

name: sgw_resource_utilization_process_memory_resident
help: The memory utilization (Resident Set Size) for the process, in bytes.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_pub_net_bytes_recv
help: The total number of bytes received (since node start-up) on the network interface to which the Sync Gateway api.public_interface is bound. By default, that is the number of bytes received on 127.0.0.1:4984 since node start-up

name: sgw_resource_utilization_pub_net_bytes_sent
help: The total number of bytes sent (since node start-up) on the network interface to which Sync Gateway api.public_interface is bound. By default, that is the number of bytes sent on 127.0.0.1:4984 since node start-up.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_system_memory_total
help: The total memory available on the system in bytes.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_warn_count
help: The total number of warnings logged.

name: sgw_resource_utilization_uptime
help: The total uptime.

name: sgw_config_database_config_bucket_mismatches
help: The total number of times a database config is polled from a bucket that doesn't match the bucket specified in the database config.

name: sgw_cache_abandoned_seqs
help: The total number of skipped sequences abandoned, based on cache.channel_cache.max_wait_skipped.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_active_revs
help: The total number of active revisions in the channel cache.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_bypass_count
help: The total number of transient bypass channel caches created to serve requests when the channel cache was at capacity.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_channels_added
help: The total number of channel caches added. The metric doesn't decrease when a channel is removed. That is, it is similar to chan_cache_num_channels but doesn't track removals.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_channels_evicted_inactive
help: The total number of channel cache channels evicted due to inactivity.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_channels_evicted_nru
help: The total number of active channel cache channels evicted, based on 'not recently used' criteria.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_compact_count
help: The total number of channel cache compaction runs.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_compact_time
help: The total amount of time taken by channel cache compaction across all compaction runs.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_hits
help: The total number of channel cache requests fully served by the cache. This metric is useful in calculating the channel cache hit ratio: channel cache hit ratio = chan_cache_hits / (chan_cache_hits + chan_cache_misses)

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_max_entries
help: The total size of the largest channel cache. This metric helps with channel cache tuning, and provides a hint on cache size variation (when compared to average cache size).

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_misses
help: The total number of channel cache requests not fully served by the cache. This metric is useful when calculating the channel cache hit ratio: channel cache hit ratio = chan_cache_hits / (chan_cache_hits + chan_cache_misses)

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_num_channels
help: The total number of channels being cached. The total number of channels being cached provides insight into potential max cache size requirements and also node usage (for example, chan_cache_num_channels * max_cache_size).

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_pending_queries
help: The total number of channel cache pending queries.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_removal_revs
help: The total number of removal revisions in the channel cache. This metric acts as a reminder that removals must be considered when tuning the channel cache size and also helps users understand whether they should be tuning tombstone retention policy (metadata purge interval) and running compact.

name: sgw_cache_chan_cache_tombstone_revs
help: The total number of tombstone revisions in the channel cache. This metric acts as a reminder that tombstones and removals must be considered when tuning the channel cache size and also helps users understand whether they should be tuning tombstone retention policy (metadata purge interval), and running compact.

name: sgw_cache_high_seq_cached
help: The highest sequence number cached. Note: There may be skipped sequences lower than high_seq_cached.

name: sgw_cache_high_seq_stable
help: The highest contiguous sequence number that has been cached.

name: sgw_cache_non_mobile_ignored_count
help: Number of non mobile documents that were ignored off the cache feed.

name: sgw_cache_num_active_channels
help: The total number of active channels.

name: sgw_cache_num_skipped_seqs
help: The total number of skipped sequences.

name: sgw_cache_pending_seq_len
help: The total number of pending sequences. These are out-of-sequence entries waiting to be cached.

name: sgw_cache_rev_cache_bypass
help: The total number of revision cache bypass operations performed.

name: sgw_cache_rev_cache_hits
help: The total number of revision cache hits. This metric can be used to calculate the ratio of revision cache hits: Rev Cache Hit Ratio = rev_cache_hits / (rev_cache_hits + rev_cache_misses)

name: sgw_cache_rev_cache_misses
help: The total number of revision cache misses. This metric can be used to calculate the ratio of revision cache misses: Rev Cache Miss Ratio = rev_cache_misses / (rev_cache_hits + rev_cache_misses)

name: sgw_cache_skipped_seq_len
help: The current length of the pending skipped sequence queue.

name: sgw_cache_view_queries
help: The total view_queries.

name: sgw_replication_pull_attachment_pull_bytes
help: The total size of attachments pulled. This is the pre-compressed size.

name: sgw_replication_pull_attachment_pull_count
help: The total number of attachments pulled.

name: sgw_replication_pull_max_pending
help: The high watermark for the number of documents buffered during feed processing, waiting on a missing earlier sequence.

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_replications_active
help: The total number of active replications. This metric only counts continuous pull replications.

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_pull_repl_active_continuous
help: The total number of continuous pull replications in the active state.

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_pull_repl_active_one_shot
help: The total number of one-shot pull replications in the active state.

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_pull_repl_caught_up
help: The total number of replications which have caught up to the latest changes.

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_pull_repl_total_caught_up
help: The total number of pull replications which have caught up to the latest changes across all replications.

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_pull_repl_since_zero
help: The total number of new replications started (/_changes?since=0).

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_pull_repl_total_continuous
help: The total number of continuous pull replications.

name: sgw_replication_pull_num_pull_repl_total_one_shot
help: The total number of one-shot pull replications.

name: sgw_replication_pull_request_changes_count
help: The total number of changes requested. This metric can be used to calculate the latency of requested changes: changes request latency = request_changes_time / request_changes_count

name: sgw_replication_pull_request_changes_time
help: Total time taken to handle changes request response. This metric can be used to calculate the latency of requested changes: changes request latency = request_changes_time / request_changes_count

name: sgw_replication_pull_rev_processing_time
help: The total amount of time processing rev messages (revisions) during pull revision. This metric can be used with rev_send_count to calculate the average processing time per revision: average processing time per revision = rev_processing_time / rev_send_count

name: sgw_replication_pull_rev_send_count
help: The total number of rev messages processed during replication. This metric can be used with rev_processing_time to calculate the average processing time per revision: average processing time per revision = rev_processing_time / rev_send_count

name: sgw_replication_pull_rev_error_count
help: The total number of rev messages that were failed to be processed during replication.

name: sgw_replication_pull_rev_send_latency
help: The total amount of time between Sync Gateway receiving a request for a revision and that revision being sent. In a pull replication, Sync Gateway sends a /_changes request to the client and the client responds with the list of revisions it wants to receive. So, rev_send_latency measures the time between the client asking for those revisions and Sync Gateway sending them to the client. Note: Measuring time from the /_changes response means that this stat will vary significantly depending on the changes batch size A larger batch size will result in a spike of this stat, even if the processing time per revision is unchanged. A more useful stat might be the average processing time per revision: average processing time per revision = rev_processing_time] / rev_send_count

name: sgw_replication_push_attachment_push_bytes
help: The total number of attachment bytes pushed.

name: sgw_replication_push_attachment_push_count
help: The total number of attachments pushed.

name: sgw_replication_push_doc_push_count
help: The total number of documents pushed.

name: sgw_replication_push_doc_push_error_count
help: The total number of documents that failed to push.

name: sgw_replication_push_propose_change_count
help: The total number of changes and-or proposeChanges messages processed since node start-up. The propose_change_count stat can be useful when: (a). Assessing the number of redundant requested changes being pushed by the client. Do this by comparing the propose_change_count value with the number of actual writes num_doc_writes, which could indicate that clients are pushing changes already known to Sync Gateway. (b). Identifying situations where push replications are unexpectedly being restarted from zero.

name: sgw_replication_push_propose_change_time
help: The total time spent processing changes and/or proposeChanges messages. The propose_change_time stat can be useful in diagnosing push replication issues arising from potential bottlenecks changes and-or proposeChanges processing. Note: The propose_change_time is not included in the write_processing_time

name: sgw_replication_push_write_processing_time
help: Total time spent processing writes. Measures complete request-to-response time for a write. The write_processing_time stat can be useful when: (a). Determining the average time per write: average time per write = write_processing_time / num_doc_writes stat value (b). Assessing the benefit of adding additional Sync Gateway nodes, as it can point to Sync Gateway being a bottleneck (c). Troubleshooting slow push replication, in which case it ought to be considered in conjunction with sync_function_time

name: sgw_database_replication_bytes_received
help: Total bytes received over replications to the database.

name: sgw_database_replication_bytes_sent
help: Total bytes sent over replications from the database.

name: sgw_database_compaction_attachment_start_time
help: The compaction_attachment_start_time

name: sgw_database_compaction_tombstone_start_time
help: The compaction_tombstone_start_time.

name: sgw_database_conflict_write_count
help: The total number of writes that left the document in a conflicted state. Includes new conflicts, and mutations that don't resolve existing conflicts.

name: sgw_database_crc32c_match_count
help: The total number of instances during import when the document cas had changed, but the document was not imported because the document body had not changed.

name: sgw_database_dcp_caching_count
help: The total number of DCP mutations added to Sync Gateway's channel cache. Can be used with dcp_caching_time to monitor cache processing latency. That is, the time between seeing a change on the DCP feed and when it's available in the channel cache: DCP cache latency = dcp_caching_time / dcp_caching_count

name: sgw_database_dcp_caching_time
help: The total time between a DCP mutation arriving at Sync Gateway and being added to channel cache. This metric can be used with dcp_caching_count to monitor cache processing latency. That is, the time between seeing a change on the DCP feed and when it's available in the channel cache: dcp_cache_latency = dcp_caching_time / dcp_caching_count

name: sgw_database_dcp_received_count
help: The total number of document mutations received by Sync Gateway over DCP.

name: sgw_database_dcp_received_time
help: The time between a document write and that document being received by Sync Gateway over DCP. If the document was written prior to Sync Gateway starting the feed, it is recorded as the time since the feed was started. This metric can be used to monitor DCP feed processing latency

name: sgw_database_doc_reads_bytes_blip
help: The total number of bytes read via Couchbase Lite 2.x replication since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_database_doc_writes_bytes
help: The total number of bytes written as part of document writes since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_database_doc_writes_bytes_blip
help: The total number of bytes written as part of Couchbase Lite document writes since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_database_doc_writes_xattr_bytes
help: The total size of xattrs written (in bytes).

name: sgw_database_high_seq_feed
help: Highest sequence number seen on the caching DCP feed.

name: sgw_database_num_attachments_compacted
help: The number of attachments compacted import_feed

name: sgw_database_num_doc_reads_blip
help: The total number of documents read via Couchbase Lite 2.x replication since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_database_num_doc_reads_rest
help: The total number of documents read via the REST API since Sync Gateway node startup. Includes Couchbase Lite 1.x replication.

name: sgw_database_num_doc_writes
help: The total number of documents written by any means (replication, rest API interaction or imports) since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_database_num_public_rest_requests
help: The total number of requests sent over the public REST api.

name: sgw_database_num_replications_active
help: The total number of active replications. This metric only counts continuous pull replications.

name: sgw_database_num_replications_total
help: The total number of replications created since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_database_num_tombstones_compacted
help: Number of tombstones compacted through tombstone compaction task on the database.

name: sgw_database_http_bytes_written
help: Number of bytes written over public interface for REST api

name: sgw_database_public_rest_bytes_read
help: The total amount of bytes read over the public REST api

name: sgw_database_sequence_assigned_count
help: The total number of sequence numbers assigned.

name: sgw_database_sequence_get_count
help: The total number of high sequence lookups.

name: sgw_database_sequence_incr_count
help: The total number of times the sequence counter document has been incremented.

name: sgw_database_sequence_released_count
help: The total number of unused, reserved sequences released by Sync Gateway.

name: sgw_database_sequence_reserved_count
help: The total number of sequences reserved by Sync Gateway.

name: sgw_database_warn_channel_name_size_count
help: The total number of warnings relating to the channel name size.

name: sgw_database_warn_channels_per_doc_count
help: The total number of warnings relating to the channel count exceeding the channel count threshold.

name: sgw_database_warn_grants_per_doc_count
help: The total number of warnings relating to the grant count exceeding the grant count threshold.

name: sgw_database_warn_xattr_size_count
help: The total number of warnings relating to the xattr sync data being larger than a configured threshold.

name: sgw_database_sync_function_count
help: The total number of times that the sync_function is evaluated. The {sync_function_count_ stat is useful in assessing the usage of the sync_function, when used in conjunction with the sync_function_time.

name: sgw_database_sync_function_time
help: The total time spent evaluating the sync_function. The sync_function_time stat can be useful when: (a). Troubleshooting excessively long push times, where it can help identify potential sync_function bottlenecks (for example, those arising from complex, or inefficient, sync_function design. (b). Assessing the overall contribution of the sync_function processing to overall push replication write times.

name: sgw_database_total_sync_time
help: The total total sync time is a proxy for websocket connections. Tracking long lived and potentially idle connections. This stat represents the continually growing number of connections per sec.

name: sgw_database_sync_function_exception_count
help: The total number of times that a sync function encountered an exception (across all collections).

name: sgw_database_num_replications_rejected_limit
help: The total number of times a replication connection is rejected due to it being over the threshold.

name: sgw_database_import_process_compute
help: Represents the compute unit for import processes on the database.

name: sgw_database_sync_process_compute
help: The compute unit for syncing with clients measured through cpu time and memory used for sync

name: sgw_delta_sync_delta_cache_hit
help: The total number of requested deltas that were available in the revision cache.

name: sgw_delta_sync_delta_sync_miss
help: The total number of requested deltas that were not available in the revision cache.

name: sgw_delta_sync_delta_pull_replication_count
help: The number of delta replications that have been run.

name: sgw_delta_sync_delta_push_doc_count
help: The total number of documents pushed as a delta from a previous revision.

name: sgw_delta_sync_deltas_requested
help: The total number of times a revision is sent as delta from a previous revision.

name: sgw_delta_sync_deltas_sent
help: The total number of revisions sent to clients as deltas.

name: sgw_gsi_views__count
help: The total number of gsi/view queries performed.

name: sgw_gsi_views__error_count
help: The total number of errors that occurred when performing the gsi/view query

name: sgw_gsi_views__time
help: The total time taken to perform gsi/view queries.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_attachment_bytes_pushed
help: The total number of bytes in all the attachments that were pushed since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_attachments_pushed
help: The total number of attachments that were pushed since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_docs_pushed
help: The total number of documents that were pushed since replication started. Used by Inter-Sync Gateway and SG Replicate.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_docs_failed_to_push
help: The total number of documents that failed to be pushed since replication started. Used by Inter-Sync Gateway and SG Replicate.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_push_conflict_count
help: The total number of pushed documents that conflicted since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_push_rejected_count
help: The total number of pushed documents that were rejected since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_deltas_sent
help: The total number of deltas sent.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_docs_checked_sent
help: The total number of documents checked for changes since replication started. This represents the number of potential change notifications pushed by Sync Gateway. This is not necessarily the number of documents pushed, as a given target might already have the change and this is used by Inter-Sync Gateway and SG Replicate. This metric can be useful when analyzing replication history, and to filter by active replications.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_connect_attempts_pull
help: Number of connection attempts made for pull replication connection.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_reconnects_aborted_pull
help: Number of times pull replication connection reconnect loops have failed.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_attachment_bytes_pulled
help: The total number of bytes in all the attachments that were pulled since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_attachments_pulled
help: The total number of attachments that were pulled since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_docs_pulled
help: The total number of documents that were pulled since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_docs_purged
help: The total number of documents that were purged since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_docs_failed_to_pull
help: The total number of document pulls that failed since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_deltas_recv
help: The total number of documents that were purged since replication started.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_deltas_requested
help: The total number of deltas requested.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_docs_checked_recv
help: The total number of document changes received over changes message.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_connect_attempts_push
help: Number of connection attempts made for push replication connection.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_reconnects_aborted_push
help: Number of times push replication connection reconnect loops have failed.

name: sgw_replication_sgr_conflict_resolved_local_count
help: The total number of conflicting documents that were resolved successfully locally (by the active replicator)

name: sgw_replication_sgr_conflict_resolved_remote_count
help: The total number of conflicting documents that were resolved successfully remotely (by the active replicator)

name: sgw_replication_sgr_conflict_resolved_merge_count
help: The total number of conflicting documents that were resolved successfully by a merge action (by the active replicator)

name: sgw_replication_sgr_num_handlers_panicked
help: The number of times a handler panicked and didn't know how to recover from it.

name: sgw_replication_expected_sequence_len
help: The length of expectedSeqs list in the ISGR checkpointer.

name: sgw_replication_expected_sequence_len_post_cleanup
help: The length of expectedSeqs list in the ISGR checkpointer after the cleanup task has been run.

name: sgw_replication_processed_sequence_len
help: The length of processedSeqs list in the ISGR checkpointer.

name: sgw_replication_processed_sequence_len_post_cleanup
help: The length of processedSeqs list in the ISGR checkpointer after the cleanup task has been run.

name: sgw_security_auth_failed_count
help: The total number of unsuccessful authentications. This metric is useful in monitoring the number of authentication errors.

name: sgw_security_auth_success_count
help: The total number of successful authentications. This metric is useful in monitoring the number of authenticated requests.

name: sgw_security_num_access_errors
help: The total number of documents rejected by write access functions (requireAccess, requireRole, requireUser).

name: sgw_security_num_docs_rejected
help: The total number of documents rejected by the sync_function.

name: sgw_security_total_auth_time
help: The total time spent in authenticating all requests. This metric can be compared with auth_success_count and auth_failed_count to derive an average success and-or fail rate.

name: sgw_shared_bucket_import_import_count
help: The total number of docs imported.

name: sgw_shared_bucket_import_import_cancel_cas
help: The total number of imports cancelled due to cas failure.

name: sgw_shared_bucket_import_import_error_count
help: The total number of errors arising as a result of a document import.

name: sgw_shared_bucket_import_import_processing_time
help: The total time taken to process a document import.

name: sgw_shared_bucket_import_import_high_seq
help: The highest sequence number value imported.

name: sgw_shared_bucket_import_import_partitions
help: The total number of import partitions.

name: sgw_collection_sync_function_count
help: The total number of times that the sync_function is evaluated for this collection.

name: sgw_collection_sync_function_time
help: The total time spent evaluating the sync_function for this keyspace.

name: sgw_collection_sync_function_reject_count
help: The total number of documents rejected by the sync_function for this collection.

name: sgw_collection_sync_function_reject_access_count
help: The total number of documents rejected by write access functions (requireAccess, requireRole, requireUser) for this collection.

name: sgw_collection_sync_function_exception_count
help: The total number of times the sync function encountered an exception for this collection.

name: sgw_collection_import_count
help: The total number of documents imported to this collection since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_collection_num_doc_reads
help: The total number of documents read from this collection since Sync Gateway node startup (i.e. sending to a client)

name: sgw_collection_doc_reads_bytes
help: The total number of bytes read from this collection as part of document writes since Sync Gateway node startup.

name: sgw_collection_num_doc_writes
help: The total number of documents written to this collection since Sync Gateway node startup (i.e. receiving from a client)

name: sgw_collection_doc_writes_bytes
help: The total number of bytes written to this collection as part of document writes since Sync Gateway node startup.
